name: 'Music Man' Quotes Quiz | The Music Man | 15 Questions

questions.text: 'I always think there's a band, kid.'
'That fella's been the raspberry seed in my wisdom tooth long enough!'

questions.explanation:
Mayor Shinn.

	Spoken numerous times throughout the film.

questions.text: 'It's Capulets like you who make blood in the marketplace!'
'He don't know one note from another!'
questions.explanation:
Charlie.

	Spoken to the salesmen on the train.

questions.text: 'When a woman's got a husband and you've got none, why should she take advice from you? Even if you can quote Balzac and Shakespeare and all of those high-faluting Greeks.'
'Oh, my dear little librarian. You pile up enough tomorrows and you'll find you've collected nothing but a lot of empty yesterdays.'
(Said with a strong lisp) 'Isn't this the most scrumptious solid gold thing you ever saw? I never thought I'd ever see anything so scrumptious as this scrumptious solid gold thing!'
'I suppose I'm not the first to think clearer when not under the spell of your salesmanship.'
'I heard you was in steam automobiles.'
'It's a well-known principle that if you keep flint in one drawer and steel in the other, you'll never strike much of a fire.'
'A man can't turn tail and run just because a little personal risk is involved. What did Shakespeare say? 'Cowards die a thousand deaths, the brave man...only 500?'

questions.explanation:
Mayor Shinn.

	Spoken to the town.

questions.text: 'One Grecian urn. Two Grecian urns. And for a fountain, trickle, trickle, trickle, trickle!'
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Shinn

	Spoken to the Ladies Dance Club.

questions.text: 'For the first time in my life, I've got my foot stuck in the door.'
questions.explanation:
Harold.

	Spoken to Marian and Winthrop.
